required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Post-Market Evaluation of HEMOBLAST™ Bellows in Laparoscopic Abdominal, Gynecological, and Urological Surgery
clinical_study.official_title: Post-Market Evaluation of HEMOBLAST™ Bellows Performance and Safety in Laparoscopic Abdominal, Gynecological and Urological Surgery

brief_summary.textblock: A prospective, multi-center, multi-national single arm study to evaluate the performance and safety of HEMOBLAST™ Bellows in laparoscopic abdominal, gynecological, and urological surgery.

detailed_description.textblock: A prospective, multi-center, multi-national single arm study conducted in Austria, France, and Germany to evaluate the performance and safety of HEMOBLAST™ Bellows in laparoscopic abdominal, gynecological, and urological surgery. Up to 100 subjects will be enrolled at up to 10 sites, with a minimum of 8 subjects enrolled in each surgical specialty.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Intraoperatively, expected within 3-10 minutes of application
primary_outcome.description: The proportion of subjects for which hemostasis was achieved after application of HEMOBLAST™ Bellows.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Intraoperative, prior to surgical closure of the subject
secondary_outcome.description: The rate of target bleeding site re-bleeding after hemostasis has been achieved with HEMOBLAST™ Bellows

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Post-operatively, expected within 1-30 days of the surgical procedure
secondary_outcome.description: The rate of re-operation due to post-operative bleeding/hemorrhage after treatment with HEMOBLAST™ Bellows

intervention.description: Surgeon has chosen to use HEMOBLAST™ Bellows as an adjunct to hemostasis when control of minimal, mild, or moderate bleeding by conventional procedures is ineffective or impractical in laparoscopic abdominal, gynecological, or urological surgeries.

study_pop.textblock: Subjects undergoing laparoscopic abdominal, gynecological, or urological procedures that meet all of the inclusion criteria and none of the exclusion criteria.

facility.name: Kliniken der Stadt Koln, Krankenhaus Merheim
